document.docAuthor: Suksai, Benjamart, Gustafson, Grey T., Sites, Robert W. & Sangpradub, Narumon
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Patrus landaisi species group from Thailand with description of three new species (Coleoptera, Gyrinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Patrus landaisi species group from Thailand with description of three new species (Coleoptera, Gyrinidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of adult
Patrus landaisi
group within Thailand

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Protarsus laterally expanded, with setose pad on posterior face.......................................... 2 (males)
- Protarsus narrow, not laterally expanded, without setose pad on posterior face............................ 9 (females)

2. Elytral glabrous region along suture extending ca. 7/9 length of elytra; elytral apex without apicolateral sinuation; species found at elevations higher than 450 m a.s.l...................................................................... 3

- Elytral glabrous region along suture extending ca. 6/7 length of elytra; elytral apex with apicolateral sinuation ( Fig. 6A, C ); species found at elevations lower than 450 m a.s.l..............................
Patrus corpulentus ( Régimbart, 1884 )

5. Elytral apex rounded, epipleural angle indistinct ( Fig. 7A ); body form in lateral view strongly dorsoventrally convex........................................................................................
Patrus garuda
sp. nov.

- Elytral apex obliquely truncate, epipleural angle distinct ( Figs. 5A , 8A , 9A , 12A ); body form in lateral view weakly dorsoventrally convex............................................................................................. 6

7. Protarsus ca. 1/2 the length of the protibia, protarsomeres width gradually decreasing apically ( Fig. 4E ); median lobe of aedeagus with needle-like apex ( Fig. 9B )..............................................
Patrus nanensis
sp. nov.

8. Mesoventrite with median pit; median lobe of aedeagus with needle-like apex ( Fig. 5B )..
Patrus apicalis ( Régimbart, 1891 )

- Mesoventrite without median pit; median lobe of aedeagus without needle-like apex, apex triangular ( Fig. 12B )............................................................................
Patrus subapicalis ( Ochs, 1930 )
stat. nov.

- Elytral glabrous region along suture extending ca. 6/7 length of elytra, lateral pubescence without convex posterior region extending towards suture, instead concave throughout ( Fig. 3B ); elytral apex with apicolateral sinuation. Found at elevations lower than 450 m a.s.l....................................................
Patrus corpulentus ( Régimbart, 1884 )

11. Elytral apex weakly rounded in appearance, epipleural angle indistinct ( Fig. 11E )............
Patrus salvazai ( Ochs, 1940 )

- Elytral apex obliquely truncate, epipleural angle distinct, weakly rounded ( Fig. 10E ).....
Patrus phetchabunensis
sp. nov.

12. Elytral apex rounded, epiplural angle indistinct, elytral glabrous region “nycteriform” (batwing-shaped) ( Fig. 3C ); reproductive tract with additional sclerotized structure between gonocoxae ( Fig. 7F )........................
Patrus garuda
sp. nov.

- Elytral apex obliquely truncate, epiplural angle distinct, reproductive tract without additional sclerotized structure between gonocoxae......................................................................................... 13

- Elytral glabrous region with posterolateral corners squared-off, not produced posteriorly ( Fig. 3D ).............................................................................................
Patrus landaisi ( Régimbart, 1892 )

14. Glabrous region of elytra narrower, occupying 9/11 elytral width; posterior lateral pubescence of elytra unevenly convex towards suture, extending obliquely with a subtruncate appearance ( Figs. 3E , 9E )..............
Patrus nanensis
sp. nov.

15. In lateral view, width of elytral pubescent margin at the humeral region nearly equal to that extending posterior; in dorsal view, lateral margin of elytral glabrous region more arcuate in appearance ( Fig. 5E )..........
Patrus apicalis ( Régimbart, 1891 )

- In lateral view, width of elytral pubescent margin at the humeral region twice that extending posterior; in dorsal view, lateral margin of elytral glabrous region less arcuate in appearance ( Fig. 12E )........
Patrus subapicalis ( Ochs, 1930 )
stat. nov.
